data.name: PoliciesPost
data.value: Policies

data.name: SuscribeInputPlaceholder
data.value: One email every Wednesday. Curated by hand.

data.name: CoverLetterFieldDescription
data.value: In a couple of paragraphs, demonstrate your enthusiasm for the company or position, and show why you're a match for what they're looking for. A custom, well written message can be the difference between getting an interview or not.

data.name: post ago
data.value: ago

data.name: FeaturedParagraph
data.value: A curated selection of standout companies doing things differently — from work culture to the products they build.

data.name: TransparentParagraph
data.value: These companies are upfront about what they pay, so you don’t have to guess or negotiate in the dark.

data.name: RemoteParagraph
data.value: Teams that operate entirely online — work from a café, a mountain cabin, or your couch, it's all good.

data.name: InternationalParagraph
data.value: Hiring people from different countries and time zones, these companies value global talent and perspectives.

data.name: AIParagraph
data.value: From smart assistants to weird chatbots, these teams are working with machine learning and AI in all kinds of ways.

data.name: EntertainmentParagraph
data.value: Companies making games, music tools, streaming apps, and other fun stuff that people actually enjoy using.

data.name: AutomotiveParagraph
data.value: Working on everything from EVs to car-sharing, these teams are doing their thing in the world of wheels.

data.name: AviationParagraph
data.value: From building drones to managing flight data, these companies are all about the skies — not just airports and planes.

data.name: BlockchainParagraph
data.value: Yes, crypto is still a thing. These teams are working on wallets, NFTs, DeFi, and other blockchain stuff (some of it actually useful).

data.name: ConstructionParagraph
data.value: Whether it’s buildings, bridges, or digital tools for the job site, these companies support the people who build the world.

data.name: ConsultingParagraph
data.value: These aren’t your typical suit-and-tie consultants — think lean teams helping others solve problems, ship faster, or clean up messy workflows.

data.name: DataManagementParagraph
data.value: Companies that deal with the messy reality of data — collecting it, organizing it, making it make sense.

data.name: DevToolsParagraph
data.value: APIs, SDKs, CLIs, and all the other acronyms that make developers’ lives easier (or at least more interesting).

data.name: EcommerceParagraph
data.value: Shops, carts, shipping — whether you’re buying socks or selling digital art, these companies help people sell things online.

data.name: EducationParagraph
data.value: Apps and platforms that help people learn new things — whether it's math, languages, or how to write better code.

data.name: EnterpriseParagraph
data.value: Big tools for big companies. These are the platforms that keep teams, projects, and systems running smoothly at scale.

data.name: EventsParagraph
data.value: Whether it’s selling tickets, hosting webinars, or managing music festivals, these companies help make events happen.

data.name: GamingParagraph
data.value: From indie studios to platform tools, these companies live and breathe games — for fun, for mobile, for consoles, for all of it.

data.name: ManufacturingParagraph
data.value: Not everything is digital — these companies help produce real, physical stuff, from factories to supply chains.

data.name: MarketingParagraph
data.value: Brands need stories, content, and analytics. These tools and teams help spread the word, reach the right people, and make it stick.

data.name: MarketplaceParagraph
data.value: Connecting buyers and sellers — from handmade crafts to niche B2B services, these platforms bring people together.

data.name: RealStateParagraph
data.value: Helping people buy, rent, or manage properties. Some make fancy tools, others just make the process less painful.

data.name: RoboticsParagraph
data.value: These companies build the kind of machines that move, sense, or think (a little). Not all of them are robots, but many are pretty close.

data.name: SaaSParagraph
data.value: Software you don’t have to install. Monthly fees, cloud dashboards, and (hopefully) helpful features for your workflow.

data.name: SecurityParagraph
data.value: Providing protection and risk management services, including surveillance, cybersecurity, and physical security.

data.name: SocialNetworkingParagraph
data.value: Online platforms for people to connect, share content, and communicate with others globally.

data.name: TranslationsParagraph
data.value: Solutions to help users translate text, speech, or content between languages, including automated translation and localization platforms.

data.name: SuscribeSectionTitle
data.value: Take the next step in your career

data.name: SuscribeSection1
data.value: Once a week, I send handpicked opportunities for developers.

data.name: SuscribeSection2
data.value: No automated lists, no fluff — only solid companies that value their teams.

data.name: SuscribeSection3
data.value: No spam, no tracking. Your email stays yours.

data.name: NesletterPageTitle
data.value: Join our developer community

data.name: NesletterPageSubtitle
data.value: Get exclusive opportunities, practical resources, and connect with professionals who value quality, innovation, and impact in their work.

data.value: Telegram Channel

data.name: TelegramCardText
data.value: Join our Telegram channel and receive the best tech opportunities and useful resources for professionals in real time.

data.name: TelegramCardButton
data.value: Go to Telegram

data.value: Go to LinkedIn

data.name: WhatsappCardText
